reviews.review:
Opposing Force is the first expansion pack of the two that were released for Half-Life on PC. Both expansions were developed by Gearbox and got support from Valve. When I first found out that the expansion packs for Half-Life were developed by Gearbox I was quite amazed. Around that time, there was a lot of drama surrounding Duke Nukem Forever and Aliens: Colonial Marines, so I was amazed that in the past Gearbox had the honor to make expansions for a game classic like Half-Life. 

In this expansion you experience the story of Half-Life from the perspective of a soldier. You are going to Black Mesa, and your aircraft crashes. You wake up and don't know what is really going on and what the mission is. 

The game itself is pretty hard for me to curate, because it all just feels and plays the same as the original game. (With the expansion having half the length of the original game.) The new features are some different weapons and enemies, both of which are creatively implemented.  The only new feature that I didn't think was all that well executed was the nightvision goggles. They looked cool at first, but they sadly only really work in short distance. 

This expansion takes place in Black Mesa for the most part, not much time is spent in alien dimensions. At the beginning, I had the feeling that the weapons were a little bit more balanced than in the original game. Because I found myself using the shotgun more often. Still there are some new weapons that I almost never used. 

What I found special about Opposing Force is that I could see that Gearbox added some more humor in the expansion than what there was in the original Half-Life itself. I still have to say that the story in my opinion didn't really add too much to what we already knew from Half-Life, but it is still fun to see it from their perspective.

The nitpick I have though is that the thing I loved about Half-Life is that there never really was a moment of standing still where you are forced to listen to someone. Opposing Force had that happen twice, sadly. This was pretty annoying when I died a few times at one of those points. (I recommend quick saving directly after you are done waiting) 

Throughout the expansions there were some nice references and they shared the same moments with the original Half-Life timeline.

The gameplay is the same mixture of shooting and exploration, just like in the original. The beginning first felt a little dull but then the game started to pick up. I especially liked the shooting at some parts, even though I hated one of the new alien enemies who in my opinion was just really annoying, an enemy which requires too much ammo to take down and does too much damage.  

Opposing Force might not be as good as Half-Life, but in my opinion it is still worth to play it if you want to have more of the same Half-Life gameplay.

Reviews of the other Half-Life games:
[url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/TrottoirManagerNL/recommended/70/]Half-Life[/url]
[url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/TrottoirManagerNL/recommended/130/]Half-Life: Blue Shift[/url]
[url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/TrottoirManagerNL/recommended/220/]Half-Life 2[/url]

I would actually argue that this game just might be better than the original Half-Life.

Sure, we all love Gordon Freeman, but this game improved so much over the original. 

One of my orginal problems with half life, was that the puzzles didn't always make sense. In this game I felt like it was a lot more fair when solving puzzles. The weapons are so much better than the previous Half-Life's, they feel more tight and there's a lot of variety this time around regarding the types of weapons you can use.

I also have to say, that this was so interesting to play story wise. You actually get to get a deeper look into the scientists, guards, and the army. They seem more like people and less like NPC's. 

Even the tutorial mode [which isn't that helpful. But I mean, there are some things you might like to know? Nothing spectacular though.] Is made so much more lifelike than the last two games. 

Sadly, this game is short.

I kind of wish I could keep playing this game, it was an amazing game but it kind of endend with "Wait- that was the ending?.." 

In conclusion/TL;DR

Half Life Opposing force, was a lot of fun. And I think it may be one of my favourite valve games of all time.
The best expansion pack of HL
Not as good as Blue Shift but it's decent

Another of the expansions that surpases the original.  I don't find though, that this is better than Blue Shift, that game flows smoother whereas Opposing Force again has too much of the platform game issues that HL has, and also this has a terrible boss fight at the end, and I'd rather no boss fight (ala Blue Shift) than a bad one.  Still, the story is cool, seeing the different alien race and species is also cool, and i feel that this game is worth a shot.  Not perfect, it has aged badly, but it tips the scale just into a reccomended game.

3/5

Black Mesa faciası sırasında farklı bir göz tarafından oynadığımız bir oyun, yani Half-Life 1 ile aynı zaman diliminde geçiyor oyunumuz. Oynadığımız isim ise Onbaşı Adrian Shepherd, HECU(Hazardous Environment Combat Unit) adlı özel askeri birimin bir üyesi.
Half-Life 1'den bildiğimiz gibi yaptığımız test sonucu Xen gezegeninden gelen uzaylılar Black Mesa'yı işgal ediyorlardı, daha sonrasında bu olaya şahit olan bilim adamlarını ve diğerlerini ortadan kaldırmak için askerler tarafından bir operasyon düzenleniyordu, işte bu operasyonun içerisinde bu oyunda rol aldığımız Onbaşı Adrian Shepherd var. 
Gerçekten ilgi çekici bir hikayesi var ve Half-Life 1'e yakışır bir standalone oyun. Tek kelime ile harika. Eğer Half-Life 1'i oynadıysanız, bu oyunu oynamamak için bir neden göremiyorum. En az Half-Life 1 kadar keyifli saatler geçireceğinizi temin edebilirim.

I enjoyed it... There were a few bugs tho, With charcaters not following me and Me having to chase them

Can't wait untill Operation: Black Mesa and Guard Duty Comes out tho (Its a remake of this with excellent graphics)

10/10
Good Game

After finally beating this game today, I have to say...this was pretty impressive for an expansion. Like Half-Life, this game has some annoying aspects such as those freaking Sewers in Chapter 10. Aside from that, this was a fantastic expansion to the original game and pretty much the definition of Government Cover-Ups.

This game offers an interesting side story to the Black Mesa Incident and while you do fight Aliens, they are pretty different from the ones you fought in the original. Barely any Headcrabs, Alien Grunts, and Vortiguants. One thing I love about expansions is added content and that is what this game offers. New military grade weapons, new alien weapons, and one new weapon developed by the Lambda Core.

The soundtrack is fantastic and the level design is pretty good. As I said, this game has some annoying aspects (that freaking Sewer), but just like the original game, the good aspects pretty much made everything bad about the game forgivable.

Now what are you waiting for? Pick this game up!
Good Game

Half-Life: Opposing Force - первый и самый успешный аддон к знаменитой игре. 

Его события снова переносят нас в кошмарные события, произошедшие в Чёрной Мезе, и позволяют нм взглянуть на ситуацию уже от лица морпеха (врага в первой части) - Адриана Шепарда. 

По качеству - аддон уступает оригиналу лишь в продолжительности. В остальном - он крупно дополняет оригинальную игру. Начиная от новых локаций, будь то офисы, склады и т.д., множество новых врагов, причём довольно страшных и трудноубиваемых (даже новый финальный босс есть, правда процесс его убиения гораздо проще, чем битва с Нихилантом). Соответственно, атмосфера и чувство страха возросли, заставляя нас экономить каждый патрон, ибо пришельцев много, и все хотят вас убить. Так же ввели новые орудия: гаечный ключ, Desert Eagle, M249, снайперская винтовка, так что всегда будет чем убивать. 

Единственный минус - в плане сюжета игра никак не дополняет, а действует по принципу "тех же щей, да погуще лей", к тому же концовка - прямое копирование оной из первой части.

I played this game a few times before buying it on Steam in a sale. It offers more of the basic HL1 gameplay but with more polish and a few welcome additions. The fights are more intense, and the new aliens keep the gameplay fresh. Human enemies feel the same though that's not necessarily bad thing. The game does a good job of showing how the situation at Black Mesa further deteriorated after HL1, as well as its climax.

Friendly NPCs are more useful since your fellow soldiers carry heavier weaponry than the Black Mesa guards. Their pathfinding still sucks but I suppose that's a problem inherent to the engine. 

There's plenty of new weapons as well, though some feel redundant or gimicky/situational (like the barnacle gun). One weapon that was very interesting was the "portal gun." Primary fire teleports the target away to Xen and does massive area damage. The secondary fire teleports you to a random location in Xen, where you can restock from ammo caches there or simply fall to your death. 

This game is also much "scarier" than HL1. Don't want to spoil much, but navigating dark caverns full of monsters or having an eight-foot-tall zombie charge you can be startling.

A worthy expansion to HL1 and I would highly recommend it to any fan.

Half-Life: Opposing Force is a challenging and inventive expansion to Half-Life that provides players with interesting new weapons and gameplay mechanics.  Players fill the boots of Cpl. Adrien Shephard, a marine stationed at a military base close to Black Mesa.  After the events of Half-Life, Shephard's squad gets called to Black Mesa to help contain the alien threat.  The game plays exactly like Half-Life, but Adrien gets access to a few weapons and abilities that Gordon did not.  For example, Adrien can climb ropes and wires.  He can also use his leadership abilities to have medics heal him or have an engineer weld a door open.  Finally, Cpl. Shephard uses several new conventional weapons (laser dot magnum, LMG, sniper rifle) and unconventional weapons found throughout Black Mesa.  Notable unconventional wepaons that get used in puzzles are the barnacle which lets you "hookshot" certain points in the world and a kind of Portal Gun that transports you to Zen for its alt fire.  All in all, I think this expansion is definitely worth a sale pickup if you enjoyed the original Half-Life and want more story.

[h1]Pros[/h1]

[list]
[*]New enemies, weapons and mechanics, the game works best when it shows the advantages you have by being a soldier.
[*]Shows you a new side of what was considered the enemy team in Half-Life.
[*]Cheap price, one of the most content full DLCs I've ever seen taking into account its $/min value.
[*]Includes the same multiplayer from Half-Life with an added Capture the Flag gamemode.
[*]There are some neat little additions in the animation department, there is a considerable amount of polishment and it shows. One of the alien guns actually have an animation that show the protagonist "petting" the creature. Very nice.
[*]During some moments in the game it will interwine with Gordon Freeman's adventure, and you'll be able to see dialogue from the original or even Gordon Freeman himself from a new PoV.
[*]There is no Surface Tension-like chapter in this one which is an absolute plus in anything related to Half-Life.
[*]The Training Camp chapter is hilarious and a joy to play.
[/list]

[h1]Cons[/h1]

[list]
[*]Many of the new weapons and enemies are re-hashes of Half-Life weapons and enemies.
[*]Some areas feel like a completely different game, pushing my suspension of disbelief that Gordon Freeman never saw the new alien race or the unbelievably differently designed areas of Black Mesa in the original Half-Life (is Black Mesa racist and only let the black guards work in one department?)
[*]The goddamn fucking green filter night vision is blinding!
[*]The game quickly abandons most of its "soldier" premise after the main team leaves and the rest of the gameplay is mostly a watered down version of Half-Life, with a few new uses of the soldier mechanics here and there.
[*]The store page advertises this game like we play as one of the soldiers ordered to murder Gordon Freeman, yet we're never really ordered to do so, as the game already starts close to the "Forget About Freeman" chapter of the original Half-Life. You barely even see Freeman through the game.
[*]Like in the original, some of the puzzles are downright impossible without a walkthrough.
[*]Like in the original, it's artificially extended, with some badly designed chapters that have no reason to exist in the middle of the actual interesting chapters.
[*]The multiplayer barely works most of the time, and is generally dominated by professionals.
[*]Disappointing cliffhanger-like ending, that will most likely never get anywhere.
[/list]

[h1]Overall[/h1]

It's still a fun game most of the time but significantly flawed and by the end of it, it's already a chore to play. I recommend only for diehard Half-Life fans since the ending has been confirmed to never get anywhere ever since Half-Life 2 released and it is really more of the artificially extended Half-Life bullshit. This game has VAC and it already includes the HD texture pack from Blue Shift.

An “interquel” to Half-Life that can be finished in a week-end, but that will prove your skills and wits. In this game you play as Adrian Shephard, one of the marines that in the original game actually try to “contain” the outbreak from Black Mesa. Shephard, though, faces his own problems as he is separated from his team and needs to find a way out of the complex, by now overrun by aliens. The game takes place during the latter part of Half-Life and besides being an interesting story to live, it also adds some new mechanics to the Valve formula, providing both story- and gameplay-wise an interesting second trip into Black Mesa at the time of the accident “caused” by Gordon Freeman. A good game, worth a shot.

SO A LITTLE TUTORIAL:
1- Buy all the Half-Life 1 games (This + HL 1 + HL Blue Shift)

2-Play Blue Shift (For da plot)

3- Play Half-Life 1 (Because it's the most worked on)

4-Play Opposing Force (Because it adds SOOO much things to Half-Life 1)

So finally you'll be filled up with good plot. (And some nice moments in your mind.)

Onbaşı Adrian Shepard Black Mesada Olayları örtbas edilmesi için bir ekibin içine katılıp Black Mesaya doğru yola çıkarılır o sırada Uçağı havada vurulur ve bir kaç saat baygın olarak kalır  - Black Mesaya girdiğinde Gordon Freemani görür ona doğru ilerler fakat Gordon Çoktan Portaldan kaçmıştır Peşinde gider fakat onu bulamaz (XEN'e) - Oyunun Sonunda Xen'den Gelen Büyük bir yaratığı öldürür ardından G-Man ona Aynı Gordon Freeman'a Yaptığı gibi Bir Konuşma Yapar ve Ona Bu olanları başkasına anlatmaması için Yukarıdan biri tarafından verilen emir ile Gordon Freeman gibi Boşlukta hapis edilir,Bunun amacı Gordon gibi Zamanı geldiğinde Kendi görevleri için Adrian Shepardı kullanmaktır 2.Oyunda Gordon'u Uyandırıp Ona görev Verdiği gibi Bence Half Life 3'tede Adrian Shepard karşımıza Çıkacak veya Half Life 3. Episode gibi Bir Bölümü olur ve Yine Adrian Shepard'ı ve Barney'i oynarız SON.

Meraklısı İçin Adrian Shepard'ın Black Mesa Olayından Önceki Günlüğü (Gman'den Bahsediyor).


Adrian Shepard'ın Günlüğü:
-200? 3 Mayıs (Adrian Shephard’ın Günlüğünden)

Asker kampında cehennem gibi geçen bir günü daha geride bıraktım.

Her şey sona erdiğinde çok mutlu olacağım. Ve sonunda bir göreve tayin edildim. Karargahta ilginç giyinmiş takım elbiseli bir adam gördüm (Gman). Dedikodulara göre onun hükümet adına çalışan yüksek seviyeli bir bürokrat olduğunu ve acemileri kendi yanında çalışması üzerine işe aldığını duydum. Diğer kişilerde gizli bir araştırma grubunun üyesi olduğunu söylüyor.

Eğer öyle bir şey varsa katılmak için elimden geleni yapardım. Bir maceranın içinde olmak ve biraz değişim hiç fena olmazdı.

-200? 5 Mayıs (Adrian Shephard’ın günlüğünden)

Sonunda hükümet adamı(Gman)’i gördüm. Onun bir hükümet adamı mı yoksa baş bir şey mi olduğundan emin değilim. Fakat çok sıkı bir takım elbise giyiyor ve yanında bir çanta taşıyordu. Daha çok bir avukatı veya sigortacıyı andırıyordu. Gün boyunca onun beni bir kaç kez izlediğini fark ettim. Benim aldığım eğitimi izliyordu. Ne yapacağını şaşkınlıkla bekliyorum.

-200? 9 Mayıs (Adrian Shephard’ın günlüğünden)

4 haftalık eğitim tamamlandı. Eğitmenler her gün yeni şeyler öğretiyorlar. Bugün sabah koşusuna hazırlandık, eğitmenlerimiz bir haftamız kaldığını ve eğitim tamamlandıktan sonra kapalı alanlarda stratejik çatışma uzmanı olacağımızı söylüyor. Bu hafta her gün savaş similasyonu tesisinde eğitim alacağız. Bu gelişmiş ve özel eğitimin bize ön hazırlık kampında söylenmediğini biliyorum.

-200? 12 Mayıs (Adrian Shephard’ın Günlüğünden)

Kapalı alan savaş teknikleri eğitimimiz başladığı günden beri dedikodular havada dolanıyor. Arkadaşlarımızın çoğu bir görev için aktif hale getirildiğimizi düşünüyor.  Kimsenin görev hakkında bir fikri yok. Ama Black Mesa Tesisini adının çok konuşulduğunu duydum. Fakat orasıyla ilgili henüz elimde hiç bir bilgi yok. Orada çok gizli bir araştırmanın yürütüldüğünü düşünüyorum. Bu olaylar benim hiç ilgimi çekmiyor.

-200? 15 Mayıs (Adrain Shephard’ın Günlüğünden)

Dedikodular doğrulandı. Black Mesa’daki bir görev için eğitim aldık. Tek bildiğim tesis bilim adamlarınca bazı yeni araştırma ve deneyler yapmak için kullanıldığı. Ne için biz askerlere orada ihtiyaç duyduklarını merak ediyorum. Bize sadece hazır olmamız emredildi. Görevin bence heyecan verici bir yanı veya potansiyeli bulunmuyor. Savaşların ve çatışmaların olduğu bir yere gönderilmeyi tercih ederdim.

Incarnez le caporal Adrian Shepard de l'unité UCEH quelques heures après la catastrophe de Black Mesa pour "nettoyer" la zone de tous extra-terrestres et témoins...

Sans doute le meilleur Half-Life de toute la saga (avec Half Life 1) et l'un des meilleurs FPS de tous les temps !

Les plus :

- Gameplay excellent
- Direction Artistique (Ambiance, Décors, ...)
- Scénario, déroulement de l'histoire
- Difficulté au rendez-vous en mode "Hard"
- Forte présence des Black Ops
- Nouvelles armes, nouveaux extra-terrestres


Les moins :

- Trop court (Hélas...)

[u]What I liked about the game[/u]
•	New weapons and enemies
•	Brilliant level design. I enjoyed exploring more parts of Black Mesa and finding secret ammunition stashes. 
•	A new training level, which is awesome. 
•	I liked the idea of playing as one of the solders, who was assigned to kill Gordon Freeman, look at his perspective and see what events uncover for him.
•	Another brilliant ending. 
[u]What I disliked or was disappointed with[/u]
•	Opposing force is a very challenging game, far more challenging than half-life, even on normal difficulty. Some of the new enemies do a lot of damage. I die a hell of lot of times while playing the game, some parts of the game were quite frustrating.
[u]My Conclusion[/u]
An excellent expansion pack, for an outstanding game. A bit too difficult in places, but overall a very enjoyable experience, which I highly recommend to anyone who enjoyed the first game.

A fine expansion. It builds upon the legendary HL gameplay (Run. Think. Shoot. Live.) and expands it with a myriad of new weapons, including many exotic ones, and many new enemies, mainly the menacing Race X. They will shoot you with lightning, poisonous darts and discharges of energy. Hazard Course was changed for a glorious Boot Camp where many drill sergeants (stereotyped after the film Full Metal Jacket) will degrade you to dirtbags, maggots and other derogatory existences. The game possesses a brilliant minimalistic soundtrack very different from the original Half-Life. AI is still quite buggy, doesn't like to follow you, gets stuck. There is no crowbar, all weapons were changed visually and functionally. There are many original features like the Barnacle Grapple that will help you latch onto organic objects and "suck" your way into them. M-40A1 Sniper Rifle, Shock Roach, Spore Launcher, XV11382, a laser sight Desert Eagle, all new toys. There are a few annoyances like operating the mortar and music stopping after loading. If you liked the original Half-Life you will love this.

I have been wanting to play this expansion when I finished playing Half -Life and so that's been many many years back. I bought it at last! 
And quess what....it's a great game even now in 2016.
Go and buy it.

Hace 3 años hice un reseña sobre este fantástico juego, y es que en esta expansión nos ofrecen un punto de vista distinto, formando parte en este caso de los HECU, básicamente nos enfrentamos a nuevos y desafiantes enemigos... cabe mencionar que en esta expansión hay muchas armas distintas como por ejemplo la pistola de portales de Black Mesa. Enfrentándonos al mismo tiempo a nuevos enemigos como la Raza X y la otra que ya todos sabemos que son los xenianos. Yendo casi a la par con Freeman en Black mesa, donde por unos segundos los caminos se cruzan. Curiosamente el escuadron de Shephard no alcanzo a emitir el motivo por el cual iban a Black Mesa. Acá hay mucha mas dificultad que el Half-Life de por sí, puesto a que hay muchos enemigos, muchos objetivos que eliminar, incluyendo los Black Ops y esas mujeres ninjas, entre otras cosas, me gustaría que Valve traiga de regreso a nuestro soldado favorito desaparecido en combate. Es de mis Hl favoritos!

HL:OF is an expansion pack to HL1 made by Gearbox. I recommend it, if you enjoyed the first version, too. This expansion pack adds more weapons, such as a Sniper Rifle and a Machine Gun. 

You pretty much fight as a member of the HECU soldiers, Shephard. The game seems a bit shorter than the original. It has an ancient multiplayer system. 

You'll like it if you enjoyed the first one, or GoldSource games in general.

"Half-Life: Opposing Force" - erschienen 1999 - ist das erste allein lauffähige Add-On zur Genregröße "Half Life".

Die geheime, riesige Forschungsstation Black Mesa. Ein Energiexperiment ist gründlich schiefgelaufen und hat ein Portal zu einer anderen Welt geöffnet. Merkwürdige, aggressive Aliens strömen in unsere Welt und greifen alles an, was ihnen über den Weg läuft. Um der Übermacht Herr zu werden, wird auch schwerbewaffnetes Militär aktiviert...

Als Corporal Adrian Shepard finden wir uns in einem Truppentransporthubschrauber wieder. Nachdem dieser gleich zu Beginn  abgeschossen wird, gilt es, zunächst alleine zu überleben, Waffen zu finden und uns gegen Sicherheitssysteme zu behaupten. 

Wieder sind die Level extrem abwechslungsreich, Shooter-Passagen wechseln sich mit Schalter- oder Jump-Passagen ab. Meist sind wir in Black Mesa unterwegs, aber durch Portale gelangen wir auch mal auf die Alien-Welt.

Meist sind wir allein unterwegs, aber in einigen wenigen Momenten sollten wir eine neue Mechanik nutzen, nämlich anderen Soldaten rudimentäre Befehle zu geben. Dabei wird "Opposing Force" nie zu einem richtigen Taktik-Shooter, über ein "schneidbrenn mir mal die Tür auf" geht es kaum hinaus; eine nette Ergänzung ist es dennoch.

Viele neue Waffen kommen ins Arsenal. Thematisch naheliegend sind sicher das Scharfschützengewehr und das Schwere Maschinengewehr. Statt eines Brecheisens haben wir nun eine Rohrzange und ein schickes Messer. Neue, sehr coole Alienwaffen sind auch am Start, unter anderem ein lebendes Alien, das wir erst füttern müssen, damit es ätzende Flüssigkeit verschießt.
 
Ansonsten funktioniert die Spielmechanik des First-Person-Shooters ähnlich reibungslos und flüssig wie im Original. Das Pacing ist hervorragend, die Rätsel interessant, der Schwierigkeitsgrad hat angezogen, was sich aber eingedenk dessen, daß man in der Regel vorher schon das Original gezockt hat und somit Übung mit den Mechaniken hat, genau richtig anfühlt. 

Auch die Ironie hat "Opposing Force" (nebenbei bemerkt wie Half-Life/Halbwertszeit oder Blue-Shift/Blauverschiebung auch unter anderem ein physikalischer Begriff) nicht verloren. So findet man zum Beispiel ein Wandbild von Gordon Freeman mit der Untertitelung "Employee of the Month" oder um einen riesigen Wurm zu besiegen, müssen eine Gearbox und ein Valve aktiviert werden.

Grafik und Sound bleiben im Wesentlichen auf dem (damals sehr guten) Stand des Hauptspiels.

Daß man die Ereignisse des Originals aus anderer Perspektive miterlebt, "Opposing Force" also praktisch parallel zu "Half Life" spielt, ist eine sehr weise Entscheidung, die wesentlich zur Immersion beiträgt, denn irgendwo jetzt läuft Gordon Freeman durch Black Mesa und kämpft seinen eigenen Kampf. Vielleicht werden wir als Adrian Shephard ja sogar über den Weg laufen...

[h1]Wertung:[/h1]
9/10 Atmosphäre
8/10 Story
8/10 Grafik
7/10 Sound
9/10 Spielmechanik
8/10 Balancing
8/10 Spielspass
(Wertungen von Klassikern beziehen immer die technischen Möglichkeiten der Zeit mit ein)

[h1]Fazit:[/h1]
Unterhaltsame Militär-Parallel-Variante des großen Originals.

[h1][b]8/10 Gesamtwertung
Opposing Force is a great expansion to Half-Life. It adds a new perspective to the game. Great gameplay, awesome atmosphere and super fun game. Buy it. 10/10

Half-Life: Opposing Force is an awesome expansion pack to the original Half-Life, but this time from the point of view of a Marine named Cpl. Adrian Shepard. The events in this game run parallel to the original so it's great to see how the other storylines unfold from a different perspective. There are a load of new weapons added and also a few new enemies to encounter. At times you will also have a squad to help you out which really gives gives the feel for some epic battles when it's your squad versus a horde of monsters. If you're itching for more Half-Life then this is a must play and is an awesome addition to Half-Life series.

Adrian Shepard :)

Half-Life: Opposing Force is one of the two standalone expansion packs for the original Half-Life. Both of the expansions are developed by Gearbox and overseen by Valve. I found Opposing Force to be better than Blue Shift, but that is just opinion. On to reviewing the actual game now. The game starts off with you being introduced to the character you play as Corporal Adrian Shephard, who is apart of the Hazardous Environment Combat Unit, or H.E.C.U. for short. You are riding a helicopter along with other members of the H.E.C.U. into the Black Mesa Research Facility, but then the helicopter is suddenly assaulted by alien aircraft. The helicopter crashes and you are knocked unconscious. You wake up in the Med Bay, with orders to hunt down and eliminate Gordon Freeman. The gameplay mechanics are the same as the original Half-Life, but with new, fun, interesting weapons. Brand new enemies, which require certain tactics to defeat efficiently. Plus new levels of course. You occasionally run into friendly soldiers on your journey throughout Black Mesa, but they are quite clunky and stupid at times. Overall the game is fun and exciting with a mysterious storyline just like the original Half-Life. It is also very fun to see the Black Mesa Incident from different a perspective.
TLDR: Fun, challenging, and mysterious like the original. This time from a different perspective. The better of the two expansion packs in my opinion.
Best plumbing simulator ever 10/10

HL:OP - spin-off oryginalnego Half-Life'a, opowiadający niejako tę samą historię, ale z zupełnie innej perspektywy - daje sporo radości, ale klimatem nieco ustępuję sławnemu poprzednikowi. Naukowca zastępuje tu konkretny zawodnik z oddziałów specjalnych, który wie, w co się pakuje i nie zamierza naparzać we wraże kreatury łomem*. Jakkolwiek Valve nie bawi się tu w twórcę pornoli, tj. nie szuka szerszego fabularnego pretekstu do radosnego napierdzielania w lewy przycisk gryzonia, tylko od razu rzuca gracza w wir ostrego walenia (z karabinu oczywiście), sama historia - choć opowiedziana nad wyraz skromnymi środkami - jest na tyle ciekawa, że grę chce się ukończyć. Żałować można tylko tego, że twórcy poszli na moralne kompromisy i zamiast zaprezentowania nam głównego herosa jako bezwzględnego egzekutora, którego nie wzruszają krzyki naukowców i ich błagania o litość, podali nam empatycznego wojownika, który brzydzi się mordowaniem bezbronnych. 
A fe.

Zalety:
+ więcej Half-Life'a.

Wady:
- graficznie dupy to już nie tylko nie urywa, ale nawet jej nie szczypie.

Ocena: 7/10

* tylko kluczem francuskim.
